greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of graphs on n vertices with domination number k.
comment: The domination number of a graph is given by the minimum size of a dominating set of vertices. A dominating set of vertices is a subset of the vertex set of such that every vertex is either in this subset or adjacent to an element of this subset.

For any graph the domination number is greater than or equal to the irredundance number (A332404) and less than or equal to the independent domination number (A332402). - _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 13 2020
link: FindStat - Combinatorial Statistic Finder, The domination number of a graph.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Domination Number
formula: T(n,k) = T(n-1,k-1) for 2*(k-1) >= n. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 17 2020
results.author: _Christian Stump_, Oct 13 2015
ext: Extended to 10 rows by _Eric W. Weisstein_, May 18 2017
